title: --nodiscover not work
body:
geth --datadir G:\sw\Geth\data\remote --networkid 99 --nodiscover --verbosity 5 --fast --bootnodes "enode://28da9010aade761f98d0f44f1a77d176f33b81b2adf70bb0c033e1a1d09309a56a5344dfc2e10252abb7f6fc95411a30b672ea3daaecdfa3347546320e9fb44c@XX.XX.XX.XX:30301" console >>remote.log 2>>&1

i already specify the boot node to find peers, but the log still shows it tried to connect to irrelevant address 

TRACE[03-29|10:25:38] Failed RLPx handshake                    addr=167.99.10.76:44336    conn=inbound err="read tcp 192.168.2.238:30303->167.99.10.76:44336: i/o timeout"

same problem here, how did you solve this ?

The logs say ` conn=inbound` -- it's other clients connecting to you, not the other way around iiuc. If you really want no comms, try `--nodiscover --maxpeers 0` or `maxpeers 2` to allow for a couple of outgoing connections.

@holiman I tried with the command with no luck, as you can see the max peers are 0 and node set to no discover -> nohup geth --rpc --nodiscover --rpcport "8545" --rpccorsdomain "*"  --rpc --rpcaddr "10.0.18.4" --datadir ./datadir --port "30306" --rpcapi "db,eth,net,web3,personal,miner,admin"  --ws --wsaddr "10.0.18.4" --wsorigins "*" --networkid 145510 --verbosity 5 --maxpeers 0 --preload './minewhenneeded.js' &

I have the same issue :/ Any resolution for this.
@ardalanrazavi  check issue #15358 there is resolution suggested there where you modify the udp.go file for encodePacket and deceodePacket functions
This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has not had recent activity. It will be closed if no further activity occurs. Thank you for your contributions.
